Vehicular movement on Pudukottai – Keeranur was disrupted for about 40 minutes when the people of Kundrandarkovil resorted to road roko at Pudukottai–Keeranur junction road, protesting against the shifting of the site for the proposed Agriculture Extension and Veterinary Health centre, on Friday.

According to the protesters, the new building for the extension centre and veterinary centre was originally planned to be built on the premises f the panchayat union office, in tune with the policy across the State. This would benefit a large number of people visiting the union office. But following some efforts for constructing these buildings at a place 3 km from the village, the people resorted to road roko. The police and revenue officials rushed to the spot and pacified the villagers.

New SP takes

charge

S. Rajeswari assumed charge as Superintendent of Police here on Friday. She succeeds E.S. Uma, who has been transferred and posted as Superintendent of Police, Tiruchi.

Service centre

inaugurated

The common service centre was opened at the M.S. Swaminathan Research Foundation’s Village Resource Centre here on Friday. S. Somasundaram, District Development Manager, inaugurated the unit. G.S. Dhanapathy, general secretary of Farmers Progressive Front, spoke. R. Rajkumar, Programme Coordinator, said the units would be started at 25 centres of the foundation, including four centres in the district in Pudukottai, Melapatti, Pullanviduthi, and Onankudi.
title: Traffic disrupted as people block road
